description: A 5-day, budget-friendly solo trip to Singapore focused on culture, nature, city highlights, and local cuisine with daily itineraries under $500 (excluding flights).

activities: Arrive in Singapore, check-in to budget accommodation, explore Little India, dinner at Tekka Centre.
accommodation: Budget hostel or capsule hotel in central Singapore (average $20-25/night)
itinerary.notes: All activities planned for free/low-cost sightseeing and food.

activities: Visit Gardens by the Bay (free outdoor gardens), Marina Bay waterfront walk, Chinatown for cheap eats.
itinerary.notes: Budget allotted as approx. $120-140 on accommodation, $60-70 on transport, meals approx. $10/day at hawker centers, rest for entry fees or extras.

activities: Morning at Sentosa (beaches, walk the boardwalk), afternoon nature walk at Southern Ridges, explore VivoCity Mall.
itinerary.notes: Flights not included in $500; if flight is needed in budget, let me know origin city.

activities: Visit National Museum (free on selected hours, else just explore the exterior), eat in Bugis, Haji Lane street art, Kampong Glam.
Botanic Gardens walk (free), shopping at Orchard Road window-shopping, farewell meal at Maxwell Food Centre before departure.
